channel.title: Need help with running a PC case fun?
channel.description:
I am going to build a "cooling" station for my PS3 that is 2.5cm - 1 inch high off the ground for air to pass through with an extra fan in the middle too cool it down a bit.
For the fan i am using a case fan from my old pc case that i replaced.
[spoiler] [img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j360/naseem142/Mobile%20Uploads/P50405-173759_zpswtph5yyo.jpg[/img] [/spoiler]
For the fan to run i am going to use this:
[spoiler] [img]http://i.ebayimg.com/00/s/NjMxWDcxMQ==/z/AsUAAOSw1x1UPLWu/$_12.JPG[/img] [/spoiler]
[b]Prototype model:[/b]
[spoiler] [img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j360/naseem142/Previewone_zpsuw6exjsx.png[/img] [img]http://i1081.photobucket.com/albums/j360/naseem142/Previewtwo_zpszypupzu0.png[/img]
The red square is the where the fan is going to be mounted, Not yet sure how but i will find out. It's going to be exactly as it is shown in the model but close.
so If i plug in the fan into the PS3 is it going to run fine with that cable i showed above?

item.title: Need help with running a PC case fun?
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:3, topic:550899”][quote author=google link=topic=669811.msg4479482#msg4479482 date=1428624674]
It should run fine, I run fans off of usb and they work fine. USB Ports are normally 5 volts. If the fan is 12 volt it wont run full speed but it will still work. In my opinion I’d plug the fan directly into the wall with a 12 volt adapter. But the usb will work just not full speed.

Example, Most phone batteries are 3.5 volts. And it takes 5 volts to charge 3, But when you plugin a 12 volt fan into a 5 volt port it’ll still work but not at the right speed. How many volts is your fan?
[/quote]

I think it’s fine if it didn’t run at full speed , it would be kinda noisy and actually perfect at like half speed or less. But incase it ran too slowly i can try a 12v adapter, thank you very much for the help.

I just finished the frame where the ps3 will sit , just waiting for the usb to fan adapter to arrive.[/quote]

Well tbh I love your idea I might have to do something like it for my laptop. Overheats while watching netflix

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with running a PC case fun?

item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“google, post:2, topic:550899”]It should run fine, I run fans off of usb and they work fine. USB Ports are normally 5 volts. If the fan is 12 volt it wont run full speed but it will still work. In my opinion I’d plug the fan directly into the wall with a 12 volt adapter. But the usb will work just not full speed.

Example, Most phone batteries are 3.5 volts. And it takes 5 volts to charge 3, But when you plugin a 12 volt fan into a 5 volt port it’ll still work but not at the right speed. How many volts is your fan?[/quote]

I think it’s fine if it didn’t run at full speed , it would be kinda noisy and actually perfect at like half speed or less. But incase it ran too slowly i can try a 12v adapter, thank you very much for the help.

I just finished the frame where the ps3 will sit , just waiting for the usb to fan adapter to arrive.
